title: Bug 12906 - Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906 - Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened (should display error message)
OB: When a file is opened in the workbench and the user tries to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking on it and selecting 'Open With' -> 'System Editor', nothing happens. There should be a warning or error message displayed, informing the user that they cannot open the file in another editor until it is closed in the current editor.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open it in another editor should display a warning message stating that the file is already opened and cannot be opened in another editor until it is closed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Close any open files in the workbench.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a Java file by double-clicking on it.
4. The file is now opened in the workbench.
5. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
6. Observe that nothing happens. Instead, there should be a warning or error message displayed, indicating that the file cannot be opened in another editor until it is closed.
